DTilt_DX.description: The horizontal variation of the tilt angle in the x direction

DTilt_DY.description: The vhorizontal  variation of the tilt angle in the  y direction

DTilt_DZ.description: The vertical variation of the tilt angle in the  y direction

DU_DX.description: Gradient of the horizontal U-wind speed along west-east axis latidude
DU_DX.long_name: Derivative of the U-wind across the west_east axis

DU_DY.description: Gradient of the horizontal U-wind speed along the north-South axis,
DU_DY.long_name: Derivative of the U-wind across the south_north axis

DU_DZ.description: Vertical gradient of the horizontal U-wind speed .
DU_DZ.long_name: Derivative of the U-wind across the height axis

DV_DX.description: Gradient of the horizontal V-wind speed along west-east axis latidudeV
DV_DX.long_name: Derivative of the V-wind across the west_east axis

DV_DY.description: Gradient of the horizontal wind speed along the north-South axis,
DV_DY.long_name: Derivative of the V-wind across the south_north axis

DV_DZ.description: Vertical gradient of the horizontal U-wind speed.
DV_DZ.long_name: Derivative of the V-wind across the height axis

DW_DX.description: Gradient of the horizontal W-wind speed along west-east axis (longitude().
DW_DX.long_name: Derivative of the W-wind across the west_east axis

DW_DY.description: Gradient of the horizontal W-wind speed along the north-South axis.
DW_DY.long_name: Derivative of the W-wind across the south_north axis

DW_DZ.description: Vertical gradient of the horizontal W-wind speed.
DW_DZ.long_name: Derivative of the W-wind across the height axis

P_x_aep.description: The probability of exceedance of the annual energy production
P_x_aep.long_name: Probability of exceedance of the annual energy production

P_x_aep_sector.description: The sectorwise probability of exceedance of the annual energy production per wind direction sector
P_x_aep_sector.long_name: Probability of exceedance of the annual energy production per wind direction sector

U.description: U is the value of the strimlined horizontal wind speed.  Wind speed is defined as a air velocity vector, with no vertical component. (Vertical motion in the atmosphere has the standard name upward_air_velocity or vertical velocity.)

USTAR.description: The fundamental scaling velocity, equal to the square root of the surface stress, to, divided by the air density. It is usually applied to motion near the ground where the shearing stress is often assumed to be independent of height and approximately proportional to the square of the mean velocity. The variable u* can also be estimated from wind observations. A rough rule of thumb is that the ratio u*/u is about 0.05 to 0.1, where u is the wind speed at a height of about 10 m, which is the standard measurement height at airports around the world.

V.description: Cross wind component of the wind speed

W.description: vertical component of the wind vector

air_density.description: The density of air or atmospheric density, is the mass per unit volume of Earth's atmosphere.

amplif.description: This is a factor that adjust the offset for the measures in vertical and horizontally.
amplif.long_name: Scaling factor for wind speed of a tabfile

bz_grid.long_name: Zooming grid of height relative to site elevation

cfd_flow_inclination.description: It is the angle of the wind flow with respect to the horizontal surface entering the wind turbine rotor,
cfd_flow_inclination.long_name: The inclination angle of the wind flow resulting from the CFD model calculation,

cfd_speedups.description: Speedups refer to the percentage speed increase due to topographic features such as orographic, obstacles (including forests, houses etc, compared to a completely flat (upstream) terrain. For CFD flow model

cfd_turbulence_intensity.description: Turbulence intensity is the ratio sqrt(TKE)/U, truncated at 100 %. TKE is turbulent kinetic energy and U is horizontal wind speed. The turbulence intensity given by WAsP is wind speed independent (as WAsP CFD calculations are Reynolds number independent) and represents neutral atmospheric conditions. For CFD flow model.

cfd_turnings.description: or deflection: Deflection is the turning of the wind due to topography, including orography obstacles as compared to a completely flat (upstream) terrain. For CFD flow model

count_bins_exceeded.long_name: Number of times the wind speed in time series exceeded the binning range

dirrix.description: Directional ruggedness index (RIX value) calculated for each of a number of radii originating at the site (met. station or wind turbine site). The RIX value for one 30-degree sector is then calculated from e.g. six such profiles, and the overall RIX value for the site from 72 profiles. A flat site will then have a RIX of 0%, a very complex (steep) site an index of, say, 30% - meaning that about one third of the terrain is steeper than the critical slope.

displacement_height.description: The displacement height is a length that is used to estimate the roughness lenght to take into account large roughness elements found locally such as Forests Villages single trees etc . This is to  take into account that when the roughness elements are close together, the flow is 'lifted' over them.

doff.description: If a wind vane is measuring the wind direction with an offset,the statistics in the tab file can be corrected by applying the offset.
doff.long_name: Offset for wind direction of a tabfile

dyn_roughness.description: It is the roughness of the surface of a water body. It varies with the surface wind shear ..
dyn_roughness.long_name: Atmospheric roughness length with charnock over water

elevation.description: height above sea level of a point on the surface of an orographic element e.g. hill, mountain

extreme_uncert.description: Uncertainty associated to the estimate of extreme wind speeds.
extreme_uncert.long_name: Uncertainty of the extreme wind speed

extreme_wspd.description:
Highest average wind speed, averaged over t sec, that is likely to be experienced within a specified time period (recurrence period) of T years
Note - Recurrence periods of T = 50 years and T = 1 year and averaging times of t = 3 s and t = 10 min are used in a number of standards. In popular language the less precise term "survival wind speed" is often used. In practice, however, the wind turbine generator system is designed using the extreme wind speed for design load cases. (IEEE Electropedia)

fetch.description: The distance travelled by wind or waves across open water.or an homogeneous land surface..

flow_inclination.description: Wind Speed vector angle with respect the surface.

gen_height.description: Standard height above the ground at which the wind is generalised

gen_roughness.description: it is the roughness related to the generalized height. JABA: or "It is the standard roughness for which the wind is generalized".

geo_turn.description: Turning of the wind per wind speed and wind direction bin
geo_turn.long_name: Relative turning per wind speed and wind direction bin over time

geo_wv_freq.description: Frequency of occurrence of the geostrophic wind vector per wind speed and wind direction bin
geo_wv_freq.long_name: Relative frequency of the geostrophic wind vector per wind speed and wind direction bin over time

gross_aep.description: Gross annual energy production, without considering wake effects.

gross_aep_sector.description: Gross annual energy production, without considering wake effects.
gross_aep_sector.long_name: Gross annual energy production per wind direction sector

gumbel_alpha.description: The location parameter tells where on the horizontal axis a graph is centered, relative to the standard normal model
gumbel_alpha.long_name: Location parameter of the Gumbel distribution

gumbel_beta.description: The scale parameter tells how streched is a graph of distribution on the horizontal axis it follows the standard deviation
gumbel_beta.long_name: Scale parameter of the Gumbel distribution

gumbel_fit_err.description: Error in the calculation of the fit of the Gumbel distribution with the experimrntal distribution of annual maxima.

height.description: It is the height above ground either related to the measurements or to the hub of a turbine.

hub_height.description: Distance from the ground to the middle of the wind turbine's rotor

landcover.description: IDentification code of the type of land cover.

landmask.description: It is a mask of 0 and1 identifying whether the site is in water or inland

max_rou_changes.description: number (index) of the segment relative to the roughness determining the first roughness change.
max_rou_changes.long_name: Segment number starting from after first roughness change

max_rou_changes1.description: number (index) of the segment relative to the roughness  before thefirst change of ruofirst roughness change.
max_rou_changes1.long_name: Segment number starting from before first roughness change

max_time.description: The time that the maximum wind event occured.

max_wdir.description: Direction of the detected maximum wind speed event.
max_wdir.long_name: Wind Direction at time of maximum horizontal wind speed

max_wspd.description: Value of the maximum horizontal wind speed.

mean_dgdz.cell_method: time: conditional mean (comment: sampled instantaneously from highest 50 percent of wind speed)
mean_dgdz.description: Magnitude of mean geostrophic shear in a geographic coordinate system. The geostrophic wind shear is a function of a horizontal temperature gradient, which is a variation in temperature over some horizontal distance. Mean geostrophic shear is at right angles to the horizontal temperature gradient, counter clockwise in the northern hemisphere. In the southern hemisphere, the change in sign of the coriolis parameter flips the direction.
mean_dgdz.name: Magnitude of mean geostrophic wind shear

mean_dgdz_dir.cell_method: time: conditional mean (comment: sampled instantaneously from highest 50 percent of wind speed)
mean_dgdz_dir.description: Direction of mean geostrophic shear in a geographic coordinate system. The geostrophic wind shear is a function of a horizontal temperature gradient, which is a variation in temperature over some horizontal distance. Note that mean geostrophic shear is at right angles to the horizontal temperature gradient, counter clockwise in the northern hemisphere. In the southern hemisphere, the change in sign of the coriolis parameter flips the direction.
mean_dgdz_dir.name: Direction of mean geostrophic wind shear

mean_pblh_scale_land.cell_method: time: conditional mean (comment: sampled instantaneously from highest 50 percent of wind speed)
mean_pblh_scale_land.description: The Height of the Atmospheric Boundary Layer at a point over land divided by the friction velocity
mean_pblh_scale_land.name: Mean boundary layer height divided by ustar (land)

mean_pblh_scale_sea.cell_method: time: conditional mean (comment: sampled instantaneously from highest 50 percent of wind speed)
mean_pblh_scale_sea.description: The Height of the Atmospheric Boundary Layer at a point over sea divided by the friction velocity
mean_pblh_scale_sea.name: Mean boundary layer height divided by ustar (sea)

mean_temp_scale.cell_method: time: conditional mean (comment: sampled instantaneously from highest 50 percent of wind speed)
mean_temp_scale.name: Surface layer temperature scale

mean_temp_scale_land.cell_method: time: conditional mean (comment: sampled instantaneously from highest 50 percent of wind speed)
mean_temp_scale_land.description: The mean characteristic dynamical temperature over land. It is the equivalent of U* in the temperature logarithm vertical profile.
mean_temp_scale_land.name: Mean temperature scale (land)

mean_temp_scale_sea.cell_method: time: conditional mean (comment: sampled instantaneously from highest 50 percent of wind speed)
mean_temp_scale_sea.description: The mean characteristic dynamical temperature over sea. It is the equivalent of U* in the temperature logarithm vertical profile.
mean_temp_scale_sea.name: Mean temperature scale (sea)

mean_z0.cell_method: time: conditional mean (comment: sampled instantaneously from highest 50 percent of wind speed)
mean_z0.name: Mean roughness length

meridian_convergence.description: Angle between the projected grid coordinates and the geographic north (positive for a clockwise rotation)
meridian_convergence.long_name: Angle between projected and geographic north

net_aep.description: Net annual energy production, considering wake effects and techincal losses.

net_aep_sector.description: Sectorwise net annual energy production, considering wake effects and techincal losses.
net_aep_sector.long_name: Net annual energy production per wind direction sector

obstacle_speedups.description: Increase, in percentage, of the wind  speed due to an obstacle as compared to a completely flat (upstream) terrain.

obstacle_turnings.description: Deflection is the turning of the wind due to an obstacle or groupps compared to a completely flat (upstream) terrain. For CFD flow model

offset.description: The coefficient of the linear equation x'=xa+b that takes into account adjustment to scale the measurement
offset.long_name: Offset for wind speed of a tabfile

orographic_speedups.description: Speed-up is the percentage speed increase due to the orography as compared to a completely flat (upstream) terrain. e.g. on top of a hill.

orographic_turnings.description: Deflection is the turning of the wind vector due to the orography features of the area.

potential_aep.description: Potential annual energy production, considering wake effects.

potential_aep_deficit.description: Deficit in the Annual Energy production

potential_aep_deficit_sector.description: Deficit in the Annual Energy production, per wind direction sector
potential_aep_deficit_sector.long_name: Annual Energy Production Deficit By Sector

potential_aep_sector.description: Potential annual energy production, considering wake effects.
potential_aep_sector.long_name: Potential annual energy production per wind direction sector

power_density.description: Power density is the amount of power available in the flow per unit surface
power_density.long_name: Mean power density of the wind speed

power_density_combined.description: Power density is the amount of power available in the flow per unit surface. The combined power density is obtained by fitting a weibull to the total distribution.
power_density_combined.long_name: Mean power density of the wind speed

power_density_sector.description: Power density is the amount of power available in the flow per unit surface for a single wind direction sector
power_density_sector.long_name: Mean power density of the wind speed

power_output.description: Electrical energy produced by the wind turbine

radial_dist.description: Maximum radial intervals in the BZ grid (100)
radial_dist.long_name: Maximum radial intervals in the BZ grid

radials.description: Maximum number of azimuthal intervals BZ grid (360)
radials.long_name: Maximum number of azimuthal intervals BZ grid

radials_x_radial_dist.description: Stacked dimension of radials and radial_dist
radials_x_radial_dist.long_name: Stacked dimension of radials and radial_dist

rated_power.description: Maximum amount of power by which the wind turbine can produce

regulation_type.description: Regulation type used by the wind turbine.

rix.description: One objective measure of the steepness or ruggedness of the terrain around a site is the so-called ruggedness index or RIX (Bowen and Mortensen, 1996), defined as the percentage fraction of the terrain within a certain distance from a specific site which is steeper than some critical slope, say 0.3 (Wood, 1995).

rms_temp_scale.cell_method: time: conditional standard deviation (comment: sampled instantaneously from highest 50 percent of wind speed)
rms_temp_scale.name: Standard deviation of surface layer temperature scale

rms_temp_scale_land.cell_method: time: conditional mean (comment: sampled instantaneously from highest 50 percent of wind speed)
rms_temp_scale_land.description: Standard deviation of Tstar over land.
rms_temp_scale_land.name: Standard deviation temperature scale (land)

rms_temp_scale_sea.cell_method: time: conditional mean (comment: sampled instantaneously from highest 50 percent of wind speed)
rms_temp_scale_sea.description: Standard deviation of Tstar over the sea.
rms_temp_scale_sea.name: Standard deviation temperature scale (sea)

rotor_diameter.description: Diameter spanned by the wind turbine rotor blades

rou_rose_dist.description: Distance to a significant change of roughness from the site or modeling point per wind direction sector
rou_rose_dist.long_name: Distance of roughness segment from modeling point

rou_rose_nrch.description: Number of significant roughness changes upwind of the site or modeling point per wind direction sector

rou_rose_roughness.description: Logarithmic average of the roughness length in each of the segments of the roughness rose.
rou_rose_roughness.long_name: Logarithmic average of the roughness length in each of the nrch segments of the roughness rose

rou_rose_slf.description: Average of the sea/land fraction in each of the segments of the roughness rose
rou_rose_slf.long_name: Average of the sea/land fraction in each of the nrch segments of the roughness rose

roughness.description: The roughness of a terrain is commonly parameterized by a length scale called the roughness length, z0. Formally, z0 is the height where the mean wind speed becomes zero, if the wind profile has a logarithmic variation with height. This usually occurs during neutral atmospheric conditions with moderate and strong wind conditions.

roughness_speedups.description: Increase in wind speed downwind of a change of roughness from rough to smooth surface e.g. landsea

roughness_turnings.description: Turning of the wind direction downwind of a change of roughness surface (not implemented)

sector.description: A sector identifies a given  range of wind directions binned around a central value , in a wind rose, to classify where the wind blows from.
sector.long_name: Wind direction binned into sectors (center value)

sector_ceil.description: The sector ceiling is the bin edge value in clockwise direction.
sector_ceil.long_name: Wind direction binned into sectors (clockwise edge value)

sector_floor.description: The sector floor is the bin edge value in counter-clockwise direction.
sector_floor.long_name: Wind direction binned into sectors (counter-clockwise edge value)

sector_freq_by_ws_bin.description: Since WAsP estimates the frequency distribution of wind speed bins for each sector, each wind speed bin has a frequency relative at that sector.
sector_freq_by_ws_bin.long_name: Relative frequency per wind_direction over time conditional on wind_speed

shear_exp.description: Exponent of a power law often used to describe the shape of the wind profile.

slfmeso.description: The mesoscale sea/land fraction is used for weighing the stability functions in the logarithmic wind profile. It is obtained by applying a weighted average (exp(-x/c)), where x is the distance to the segment and c is the coastal decay length.

south_north_geog.description: Positive northward direction in geographic coordinates (degrees).

south_north_proj.description: Positive northward direction in projected coordinates (meters).

spec_corr_fac.description: The Spectral Correction factor is a correction derived using the so-called  Spectral correction method to recover the  smoothing effect due to the model resolution. This method allows to use in order to use the long-term modellled time series by models.o facilitate extreme wind estimation using modelled data.

spectrum_power.description: The distribution of power with frequency of a signal in a time series. Physical signals in a time series can be decomposed into a number of discrete frequencies.

stationary_thrust_coefficient.description: The wind turbine thrust coefficient with the rotor at rest

sum_dugdz.name: Sum of zonal geostrophic wind shear

sum_dvgdz.name: Sum of meridional geostrophic wind shear

sum_pblh.name: Sum of planetary boundary layer height

temp_scale.description: Surface-layer temperature scale that is obtained by dividing the kinematic surface-layer heat flux by the friction velocity in neutral or stable conditions and dividing by the convective velocity scale in unstable conditions
temp_scale.name: Surface layer temperature scale

terrain_inclination.description: It is the measurement of the slope of the terrain.

thrust_coefficient.description: The thrust coefficient is a non-dimensional number that describes the force exerted by the turbine in the axial direction to the incoming momentum of the flow

turbulence_intensity_effective_sector.description: Effective turbulence intensity by wind direction sector

user_def_speedups.description: Speed-up is the percentage speed increase specificed by the user

user_def_turnings.description: Turning of the wind vector in degrees specified by the user

ustar_over_pblh.description: The friction velocity divided by the height of the Atmospheric Boundary Layer
ustar_over_pblh.name: ustar divided by boundary layer height

wd_count.long_name: Count of wind direction per wind_direction bin over time

wdfreq.description: Frequency of occurance for each wind direction bin/sector
wdfreq.long_name: Relative frequency per wind_direction over time and wind_speed

weib_A.description: Scale parameter in the Weibull distribution

weib_A_combined.description: Scale parameter in the Weibull distribution for all wind directions, representing the frequency-weighted averaged value of the sectors.

weib_k.description: Form parameter in the Weibull distribution identify the shape of the distribution. This can be connected to characteristics of theterrain surrounding themeasuring masts

weib_k_combined.description: Form parameter in the Weibull distribution for all directions, representing the frequency-weighted averaged value of the sectors. The Weibull form parameter identifies the shape of the distribution.

west_east_geog.description: Positive eastward direction in geographic coordinates (degrees).

west_east_proj.description: Positive eastward direction in projected coordinates (meters).

wind_direction.description: Wind is defined as a two-dimensional (horizontal) air velocity vector, with no vertical component. (Vertical motion in the atmosphere has the standard name upward_air_velocity.) In meteorological reports, the direction of the wind vector is usually (but not always) given as the direction from which it is blowing (wind_from_direction) (westerly, northerly, etc.). In other contexts, such as atmospheric modelling, it is often natural to give the direction in the usual manner of vectors as the heading or the direction to which it is blowing (wind_to_direction) (eastward, southward, etc.) "from_direction" is used in the construction X_from_direction and indicates the direction from which the velocity vector of X is coming.

wind_speed.description: Speed is the magnitude of velocity. Wind is defined as a two-dimensional (horizontal) air velocity vector, with no vertical component. (Vertical motion in the atmosphere has the standard name upward_air_velocity.) The wind speed is the magnitude of the wind velocity.

wind_speed_combined.description: Mean wind speed for all wind directions, representing the frequency-weighted averaged value of the sectors.

wind_speed_cutin.description: The cut-in speed is when the blades start rotating and generating power

wind_speed_cutout.description: The wind speed cut-out speed is the maximum wind speed that a wind turbine can handle before it shuts down to prevent damage

wind_speed_sector.description: sector refers to a range of wind directions binned

ws_bin_freq.description: Frequency of a wind speed bin in each sector
ws_bin_freq.long_name: Relative frequency per wind speed over time and wind direction

wsbin.description: A wind speed bin refers to a range of wind speeds. The wind speed bin is associated with the center value of the bin, half-way between the bin edges (min and max values).
wsbin.long_name: Binned wind speed (center value of bin)

wsceil.description: The wind speed bin ceiling is the maximum value covered by the wind speed bin.
wsceil.long_name: Binned wind speed (upper bin edge value)

wsfloor.description: The wind speed bin floor is the minimum value covered by the wind speed bin.
wsfloor.long_name: Binned wind speed (lower bin edge value)

wsfreq.description: Frequency of occurrence of a given wind speed bin in each sector
wsfreq.long_name: Relative frequency per wind speed over time conditional on wind direction

wv_count.description: Count of the horizontal wind speed vector per wind speed bin and wind direction sector.
wv_count.long_name: Count of the horizontal wind vector per wind speed and wind direction over time

wv_freq.description: Relative frequency of wind speed and wind direction over time. Summing over dimensions wind speed bin and wind direction sectors gives 1.
wv_freq.long_name: Relative frequency per wind speed and wind direction over time

z0meso.description: It is the roughness of a large area upwind.

z0sum.description: Value of the sum of zo over all sectors.
z0sum.name: Sum of roughness length
